welcome.title: Welcome to BenchPOS
welcome.intro: Welcome to BenchPOS, your all-in-one solution for managing sales, inventory, and business reporting. This help center will guide you through all the features and functions of the application.

sales.title: Sales & Billing
sales.description: Create invoices, manage transactions, and process payments efficiently.

inventory.title: Inventory Management
inventory.description: Track stock levels, add products, and manage your inventory with ease.

reports.title: Reports & Analytics
reports.description: Generate detailed reports to gain insights into your business performance.

offline.title: Offline & Sync
offline.description: Work offline and synchronize your data across devices when connected.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.intro: To begin using BenchPOS, we recommend following these steps:

step1.title: Set up your business information
step1.description: Configure your business details in the Settings section.

step2.title: Add your inventory
step2.description: Add your products and set up initial stock levels.

step3.title: Create user accounts
step3.description: Add users and assign appropriate roles for your staff.

step4.title: Customize receipt templates
step4.description: Personalize your receipts with your business information and branding.

step5.title: Start selling
step5.description: Begin creating invoices and processing sales.

proTip.title: Pro Tip:
proTip.content: Take some time to explore the application and familiarize yourself with its features before going live with real transactions.

feature1.title: Multi-User Support
feature1.description: Create accounts with different roles (Admin, Manager, Cashier) to control access to sensitive functions.

feature2.title: Offline Mode
feature2.description: Continue operations even without internet connectivity. Data will sync automatically when connection is restored.

feature3.title: Detailed Reporting
feature3.description: Access daily, weekly, and monthly reports for sales, inventory, and profitability.

feature4.title: Receipt Printing
feature4.description: Generate and print professional receipts for customer transactions.

feature5.title: Data Backup
feature5.description: Automatically backup your data to prevent loss of important business information.

feature6.title: Multi-Device Sync
feature6.description: Synchronize data across multiple devices to keep your business information up-to-date everywhere.

quickStart.title: Quick Start Guide
quickStart.intro: This guide will help you quickly set up and start using BenchPOS for your business operations.

installation.title: Installation
installation.intro: BenchPOS is a desktop application that requires installation on your computer:

step1.title: Download the installer
step1.description: Visit our website and download the appropriate installer for your operating system (Windows, macOS, or Linux).

step2.title: Run the installer
step2.description: Double-click the downloaded file and follow the on-screen instructions.

step3.title: Complete the installation
step3.description: Choose your installation location, create shortcuts, and complete the installation process.

step4.title: Launch the application
step4.description: Use the desktop shortcut or start menu entry to launch BenchPOS.

note.title: Note:
note.description: You may need administrator privileges to install the application on your computer.

firstLogin.title: First Login
firstLogin.intro: When you launch BenchPOS for the first time, you'll need to create an admin account:

step1.title: Create admin account
step1.description: Enter your name, email, and create a secure password for the administrator account.

step2.title: Verify your email
step2.description: Check your email for a verification link and click it to verify your account.

step3.title: Login with admin credentials
step3.description: Use your email and password to log into the system.

businessSetup.title: Business Setup
businessSetup.intro: Configure your business information in the Settings section:

step1.title: Navigate to Settings
step1.description: Click on the "Settings" icon in the sidebar menu.

step2.title: Go to Business Information
step2.description: Select the "Business Info" tab from the settings sidebar.

step3.title: Enter business details
step3.description: Enter your business name, address, contact information, and tax ID.

step4.title: Upload your logo
step4.description: Add your business logo which will appear on invoices and receipts.

step5.title: Set currency and tax settings
step5.description: Configure your default currency and tax rates.

step6.title: Save changes
step6.description: Click the "Save Changes" button to apply your business settings.

addingProducts.title: Adding Products
addingProducts.intro: Start building your inventory by adding products:

step1.title: Go to Inventory
step1.description: Click on the "Inventory" icon in the sidebar menu.

step2.title: Add a new product
step2.description: Click the "Add Product" button to open the product form.

step3.title: Enter product details
step3.description: Add the product name, SKU, category, price, cost, and initial stock quantity.

step4.title: Save the product
step4.description: Click "Save" to add the product to your inventory.

tip.title: Pro Tip:
tip.description: You can also import multiple products at once using the "Import Products" feature with a CSV file.

step1.title: Go to New Sale
step1.description: Click on the "New Sale" icon in the sidebar menu.

step2.title: Add items to cart
step2.description: Search for products and click on them to add to the cart, or scan barcodes if available.

step3.title: Adjust quantities
step3.description: Change the quantity of items as needed.

step4.title: Add customer information
step4.description: Enter customer details if desired for the receipt.

step5.title: Apply discounts if needed
step5.description: Add any applicable discounts to individual items or the entire sale.

step6.title: Complete the sale
step6.description: Click "Complete Sale" button to process the transaction.

step7.title: Print or email receipt
step7.description: Generate a receipt that can be printed or emailed to the customer.

systemRequirements.title: System Requirements
systemRequirements.intro: BenchPOS is designed to run efficiently on modern computers. Check if your system meets the requirements below.

internet.name: Internet Connection
internet.minimum: Required for initial setup and synchronization

receiptPrinting.item1: Thermal receipt printer (compatible with ESC/POS commands)
receiptPrinting.item2: Standard desktop printer for A4/Letter paper receipts

barcodeScanning.title: Barcode Scanning
barcodeScanning.item1: USB Barcode Scanner compatible with your operating system
barcodeScanning.item2: Webcam with at least 720p resolution for QR code scanning

multiDeviceSync.title: Multi-Device Sync
multiDeviceSync.item2: Firebase account (free tier is sufficient for small businesses)

dataBackup.title: Data Backup
dataBackup.item1: External storage device or cloud storage account
dataBackup.item2: Sufficient storage space for regular backups

supportedBrowsers.title: Supported Browsers (for Web Sync Portal)
supportedBrowsers.intro: If you use the optional web sync portal, it's supported on the following browsers:

importantNote.title: Important:
importantNote.content: While BenchPOS can operate offline, an internet connection is required for initial setup, updates, and data synchronization between devices.

performanceConsiderations.title: Performance Considerations
performanceConsiderations.intro: The performance of BenchPOS may vary based on:

factors.item1: The size of your product database (5,000+ products may require more RAM)
factors.item2: The number of concurrent users if multiple terminals are in use
factors.item3: The frequency of synchronization between devices
factors.item4: The size and number of images stored for products

performanceConsiderations.recommendation: For large businesses with 10,000+ products or high transaction volumes, we recommend upgrading to the recommended specifications for optimal performance.

createInvoice.title: Creating Invoices
createInvoice.intro: Learn how to create and manage invoices for your customers in BenchPOS. Creating accurate invoices is essential for tracking sales, managing inventory, and maintaining financial records.

accessingSale.title: Accessing the New Sale Screen
accessingSale.intro: To create a new invoice, you'll need to access the New Sale screen:

step1.title: Navigate to New Sale
step1.description: Click on the "New Sale" button in the main navigation sidebar

step2.title: Understand the Interface
step2.description: The New Sale screen is divided into two main sections:
step2.leftPanel: Left Panel: Product search and selection
step2.rightPanel: Right Panel: Current invoice details and calculations

accessingSale.screenshot: New Sale screen with product selection and invoice details

addingItems.title: Adding Items to an Invoice
addingItems.intro: There are multiple ways to add items to your invoice:

search.title: Search and Select
search.description: Use the search bar to find products by name, SKU, or description, then click to add them to your invoice.

barcode.title: Barcode Scanning
barcode.description: Use the barcode entry field to scan product barcodes or enter codes manually to quickly add items.

browse.title: Browse Products
browse.description: Browse through your product catalog and click "Add to Cart" on any product card to add it to the invoice.

step1.title: Use the product search bar
step1.description: Type the product name, SKU, or description in the search field at the top of the left panel

step2.title: Select from results
step2.description: Click on the product from the search results to add it to the invoice

step3.title: Adjust quantity
step3.description: Change the quantity as needed using the quantity selector in the invoice table

step1.title: Access barcode entry
step1.description: Click on the barcode entry field or press B on your keyboard

step2.title: Scan or enter barcode
step2.description: Scan the product barcode using a connected scanner or type the barcode number manually

step3.title: Add to invoice
step3.description: Click "Add Item" or press Enter to add the product to the invoice

proTip.title: Pro Tip:
proTip.content: When using a barcode scanner, the system will automatically add the item to the invoice. If scanning multiple units of the same item, scan once, then adjust the quantity in the invoice.

adjusting.title: Adjusting Quantities and Removing Items
adjusting.intro: After adding items to your invoice, you can modify them as needed:
adjusting.quantityDesc: Use the quantity selector in the invoice table to change the amount
adjusting.removeDesc: Click the "Remove" icon in the Action column to delete an item from the invoice

managingCustomers.title: Managing Customer Information
managingCustomers.intro: Adding customer information to invoices helps with record-keeping and customer relationship management:

step1.title: Add Customer Details
step1.description: Click in the "Customer name" field at the top of the invoice

step2.title: Search Existing Customers
step2.description: Start typing to search for existing customers in your database

step3.title: Select a Customer
step3.description: Click on a customer from the dropdown to auto-fill their details

note.title: Note:
note.content: If this is a new customer, you can create a new record by clicking the "+" icon next to the Customer field and filling in their details in the popup form.

applyingDiscounts.title: Applying Discounts and Taxes
applyingDiscounts.intro: You can apply discounts and adjust taxes for the entire invoice or for individual items:

discounts.title: Applying Discounts

step1.title: For the Entire Invoice
step1.description: Click the "Add Discount" button below the subtotal

step2.title: Select Discount Type
step2.description: Choose between percentage (%) or fixed amount

step3.title: Enter Value
step3.description: Enter the discount value and click "Apply"

discounts.screenshot: Discount dialog for applying discounts to an invoice

taxes.title: Managing Taxes
taxes.intro: Tax rates are automatically applied based on your system settings. To adjust tax for the current invoice:

step1.title: Click on Tax Field
step1.description: Click on the tax field in the invoice summary

step2.title: Select Tax Rate
step2.description: Choose a different tax rate or enter a custom rate

step3.title: Apply Changes
step3.description: Click "Apply" to update the invoice with the new tax calculation

warning.title: Important:
warning.content: Ensure you apply the correct tax rates according to your local regulations. Incorrect tax applications may lead to compliance issues.

completingSale.title: Completing a Sale
completingSale.intro: When you've finished adding items and making adjustments, you can complete the sale:

step1.title: Review the Invoice
step1.description: Check all items, quantities, prices, customer information, and applied discounts or taxes

step2.title: Click "Complete Sale"
step2.description: Press the "Complete Sale" button (or use the F3 shortcut)

step3.title: Process Payment
step3.description: Select the payment method (cash, credit card, etc.) and enter the amount received

step4.title: Finalize the Transaction
step4.description: Click "Complete Transaction" to save the invoice and update your inventory

step5.title: Print or Email Receipt
step5.description: Choose to print, email, or both for the customer receipt

managingInvoices.title: Managing Existing Invoices
managingInvoices.intro: You can browse, search, and manage all your previously created invoices:

browse.title: Browse Invoices
browse.description: Click "Browse Invoices" on the New Sale screen to view all your invoices and use filters to find specific ones.

edit.title: Edit Invoices
edit.description: Open any existing invoice and make adjustments as needed, then save your changes.

returns.title: Process Returns
returns.description: Handle returns and refunds through the original invoice with the "Refund Selected" option.

shortcuts.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
shortcuts.intro: To speed up invoice creation, use these keyboard shortcuts:

invoiceProcess.question: Invoice won't complete or process
invoiceProcess.item1: Ensure all required fields are filled out
invoiceProcess.item2: Verify that product quantities don't exceed available stock
invoiceProcess.item3: Confirm that the payment amount covers the total

itemsSearch.question: Items not appearing in search
itemsSearch.item1: Check if the product is marked as "active" in inventory
itemsSearch.item2: Verify the spelling in your search
itemsSearch.item3: Try searching by SKU instead of product name

customerNotFound.question: Customer not found in database
customerNotFound.item1: Try searching with different spellings or partial name
customerNotFound.item2: Check if the customer exists under a different name
customerNotFound.item3: Create a new customer record if needed

manageTransactions.title: Managing Transactions
manageTransactions.intro: Learn how to view, filter, edit, and manage your sales transactions in BenchPOS. Efficient transaction management helps you keep track of your business activities and maintain accurate financial records.

accessingTransactions.title: Accessing Transaction History
accessingTransactions.intro: To view your transaction history and manage existing invoices:

step1.title: Navigate to Transactions
step1.description: Click on the "Transactions" icon in the main navigation sidebar

step2.title: View Transaction List
step2.description: The main transaction screen displays a list of all transactions with key information including:

accessingTransactions.screenshot: Transaction list showing recent sales and their status

filteringTransactions.title: Filtering and Searching Transactions
filteringTransactions.intro: You can quickly find specific transactions using these tools:

search.title: Search
search.description: Use the search bar to find transactions by invoice number, customer name, or item description.

dateFilters.title: Date Filters
dateFilters.description: Filter transactions by date range, including today, this week, this month, or custom periods.

statusFilters.title: Status Filters
statusFilters.description: Filter by payment status (paid, unpaid, partially paid) or transaction type (sales, returns).

proTip.title: Pro Tip:
proTip.content: You can save frequently used filters as presets by clicking the "Save Filter" button after setting up your criteria. Access saved filters from the dropdown menu.

viewingDetails.title: Viewing Transaction Details
viewingDetails.intro: To see the complete details of any transaction:

step1.title: Select a Transaction
step1.description: Click on any transaction in the list to view its details

step2.title: Review Transaction Information
step2.description: The transaction details screen shows:

info.item1: Complete item list with quantities and prices

step3.title: Access Additional Options
step3.description: From the details screen, you can:

viewingDetails.screenshot: Detailed view of a transaction showing items, payments, and available actions

editingTransactions.title: Editing Existing Transactions
editingTransactions.intro: You can edit certain aspects of a transaction depending on its status:

step1.title: Open Transaction Details
step1.description: Locate and click on the transaction you want to edit

step2.title: Enter Edit Mode
step2.description: Click the "Edit" button in the transaction details screen

step3.title: Make Changes
step3.description: Modify the allowed fields based on the transaction status

step4.title: Save Changes
step4.description: Click "Save Changes" to update the transaction

warning.title: Important:
warning.content: All transaction edits are logged in the system for auditing purposes. Major changes to completed transactions may require manager approval depending on your system settings.

processingPayments.title: Processing Payments for Outstanding Invoices
processingPayments.intro: For transactions with outstanding balances, you can process additional payments:

step1.title: Find the Transaction
step1.description: Locate the transaction with an outstanding balance

step2.title: Open Payment Screen
step2.description: Click the "Process Payment" button in the transaction details

step3.title: Enter Payment Details
step3.description: Select the payment method and enter the amount being paid

step4.title: Complete Payment
step4.description: Click "Complete Payment" to record the transaction

step5.title: Update Payment Status
step5.description: The system will automatically update the payment status to "Paid" or "Partially Paid"

note.title: Note:
note.content: You can process partial payments multiple times until the full amount is paid. Each payment is recorded separately for accurate bookkeeping.

transactionReports.title: Generating Transaction Reports
transactionReports.intro: You can generate various reports from your transaction data:

step1.title: Access Reports Section
step1.description: From the Transactions screen, click the "Reports" button

step2.title: Select Report Type
step2.description: Choose from available report types:

step3.title: Set Parameters
step3.description: Define the date range and any additional filters for your report

step4.title: Generate Report
step4.description: Click "Generate Report" to create the report

step5.title: Export or Print
step5.description: Choose to view on screen, export (CSV, PDF, Excel), or print the report

visual.title: Visual Reports
visual.description: View transaction data as charts and graphs for better visualization of business performance.

scheduled.title: Scheduled Reports
scheduled.description: Set up recurring reports to be automatically generated and emailed on a schedule.

custom.title: Custom Reports
custom.description: Create custom report templates tailored to your specific business needs.

processReturns.title: Processing Returns
processReturns.intro: Learn how to process product returns and issue refunds to customers in BenchPOS. Properly handling returns helps maintain accurate inventory records and ensures customer satisfaction.

understandingReturns.title: Understanding Returns Process
understandingReturns.description: The BenchPOS handles returns by referencing the original sales transaction. This approach ensures proper inventory tracking and maintains the connection between sales and returns for accurate reporting.
understandingReturns.note: Note: Returns can only be processed for items that were sold through the system. For each return, you'll need to reference the original sale by invoice number or by finding the transaction.

accessingReturns.title: Accessing the Returns Feature
accessingReturns.intro: There are two main ways to access the returns feature:

fromTransaction.title: From Transaction History
fromTransaction.description: Find the original sale in your transaction history and initiate the return from there.

usingInvoice.title: Using Invoice Number
usingInvoice.description: Enter the invoice number from the customer's receipt to quickly locate the transaction.

processingFullReturns.title: Processing Full Returns
processingFullReturns.intro: To process a complete return of all items in a sale:

step1.title: Find the Original Transaction
step1.description: Locate the transaction in your history or search by invoice number

step2.title: Open Return Interface
step2.description: Click the "Process Return" button in the transaction details

step3.title: Select All Items
step3.description: By default, all items will be selected. Verify that quantities match what's being returned

step4.title: Click "Refund Selected"
step4.description: This will indicate that all items are being returned to inventory

step5.title: Choose Refund Method
step5.description: Select how the customer will be refunded (original payment method, store credit, etc.)

step6.title: Complete Refund
step6.description: Click the "Complete Refund" button to process the return

step7.title: Print Return Receipt
step7.description: Generate a return receipt for the customer

screenshot.caption: Full return process showing items selected and the "Refund Selected" button

processingPartialReturns.title: Processing Partial Returns
processingPartialReturns.intro: For returning only some items from a sale:

step1.title: Find the Original Transaction
step1.description: Locate the transaction as described above

step2.title: Open Return Interface
step2.description: Click the "Process Return" button in the transaction details

step3.title: Select Specific Items
step3.description: Check only the items that are being returned

step4.title: Adjust Quantities if Needed
step4.description: If returning only some units of a product, adjust the quantity accordingly

step5.title: Click "Refund Selected"
step5.description: This will process only the selected items

step6.title: Choose Refund Method
step6.description: Select how the customer will be refunded for the returned items

step7.title: Complete Refund
step7.description: Click the "Complete Refund" button to process the partial return

processingPartialReturns.proTip: Pro Tip: When processing partial returns, the system will automatically calculate the correct refund amount based on the original per-item price, including any discounts that were applied during the sale.

screenshot.caption: Partial return process with specific items selected for return

returnReasons.title: Recording Return Reasons
returnReasons.intro: Tracking why items are returned helps improve inventory management and customer service:

step1.title: During Return Process
step1.description: After selecting items for return, you'll see a "Return Reason" dropdown menu

step2.title: Select Appropriate Reason
step2.description: Choose from common return reasons such as:

step3.title: Add Notes if Needed
step3.description: For complex situations, add detailed notes about the return

step4.title: Specify Item Condition
step4.description: Indicate whether the item can be returned to inventory or must be discarded

returnReasons.warning: Important: Return reasons and item condition affect inventory management. Items marked as defective or damaged will not be added back to available inventory but will be tracked in separate inventory reports.

returnsReporting.title: Returns Reporting
returnsReporting.intro: BenchPOS provides detailed reports on returns to help analyze trends:

summary.title: Returns Summary
summary.description: View overall return rates, total return value, and comparison with sales volume over time.

reasons.title: Return Reasons Analysis
reasons.description: Analyze the most common reasons for returns to identify product quality or customer service issues.

products.title: Product Return Rates

outOfPolicy.answer: The system will display a warning if you attempt to process a return outside the configured return period. By default, returns after 30 days require manager approval, and returns after 90 days require administrator approval. These timeframes can be customized in your system settings.

For even exchanges (same price), you can check the "Exchange" option during the return process, which will generate a credit note that can be applied immediately to a new sale.

adjustments.title: Stock Adjustments and Reasons

initialStock.whenToUse: When setting up initial inventory or adding new products
initialStock.effect: Recorded as initial inventory, no effect on cost/profit

stockReceived.whenToUse: When receiving new shipments from suppliers
stockReceived.effect: Updates average cost if purchase price differs from existing stock

inventoryCount.whenToUse: After performing a physical inventory count
inventoryCount.effect: Recorded as inventory adjustment, may affect inventory valuation

damaged.whenToUse: When removing items due to damage or expiration
damaged.effect: Recorded as loss, affects profitability reports

internalUse.whenToUse: Items used by the business (not for sale)
internalUse.effect: Recorded as expense, affects profitability reports

theft.whenToUse: Items lost due to theft or unexplained loss
theft.effect: Recorded as shrinkage, affects loss reports

performance.title: Product Performance Analysis
performance.intro: Product Performance reports help you analyze the sales and profitability of your inventory:

velocity.title: Sales Velocity
velocity.description: Track how quickly products sell, helping you optimize stock levels and identify fast-moving items.

margin.title: Profit Margin Analysis
margin.description: Analyze profit margins across products to identify your most and least profitable inventory items.

turnover.title: Inventory Turnover
turnover.description: Measure how many times your inventory is sold and replaced over a period to assess efficiency.

steps.step1Description: Navigate to Reports & Analytics > Inventory Reports
steps.step2Description: Click on "Product Performance" in the sidebar menu
steps.step3Description: Select the specific performance metric you want to analyze
steps.step4Description: Set the time period and any filters needed
steps.step5Description: Analyze the data presented in tables and charts

performance.tip: Use the Product Performance Analysis to identify "dead stock" (items that haven't sold in a long time) and consider running promotions or clearance sales to convert these items into cash.

movement.title: Inventory Movement Reports
movement.intro: Inventory Movement reports track changes in your inventory over time:

steps.step1Description: Go to Reports & Analytics > Inventory Reports > Inventory Movement
steps.step3Description: Filter by date range, product, category, or adjustment reason
steps.step4Description: Analyze the movement history to track inventory changes

movement.note: Inventory Movement reports are particularly useful for auditing and inventory reconciliation, as they provide a complete history of all stock changes, including who made the changes and when.

thresholds.question: How are low stock thresholds determined?
thresholds.answer: Low stock thresholds can be set in several ways:

methods.manual: Manual setting: You can set a specific threshold for each product in the product details.
methods.category: Category defaults: You can set default thresholds by product category.
methods.automatic: Automatic calculation: The system can calculate suggested thresholds based on sales velocity and your specified lead time for reordering.

thresholds.configure: To configure low stock thresholds, go to Inventory > Settings > Stock Alerts.

discrepancies.question: Why might there be discrepancies in my inventory reports?
discrepancies.answer: Discrepancies in inventory reporting might occur due to:

reasons.sales: Sales or returns processed while viewing a report
reasons.adjustments: Manual stock adjustments made by staff
reasons.negative: Items with negative stock values (if allowed in settings)
reasons.timing: Timing differences between reports generated at different times
reasons.unprocessed: Unprocessed receiving orders or stock transfers

discrepancies.solution: Regular physical inventory counts and reconciliation can help ensure your system data matches your actual inventory.

slowMoving.question: How can I identify products that aren't selling well?
slowMoving.answer: To identify slow-moving or non-selling products:

steps.step1: Go to Reports & Analytics > Inventory Reports
steps.step4: Set the time period (e.g., last 30, 60, or 90 days)
steps.step5: The report will show products with low or no sales during the period

slowMoving.additional: You can also sort any product report by "Units Sold" in ascending order to see the least-sold items first.

exportingData.title: Exporting Data
exportingData.intro: Learn how to export data from BenchPOS for analysis, backup, or use in other business applications. Exporting data allows you to create custom reports, share information with stakeholders, and perform advanced analysis using your preferred tools.

overview.title: Data Export Overview
overview.intro: BenchPOS allows you to export various types of data in multiple formats:

csv.title: CSV Format
csv.description: Comma-Separated Values (CSV) files that can be opened in spreadsheet applications like Excel or Google Sheets.

pdf.title: PDF Format
pdf.description: Formatted reports in PDF format suitable for printing, sharing, or archiving.

excel.title: Excel Format
excel.description: Native Excel (XLSX) files with formatting and multiple sheets (available for certain reports).

reports.title: Exporting Reports
reports.intro: You can export any report generated in the system:

steps.step1Description: Navigate to the Reports & Analytics section and generate the desired report
steps.step2Description: Use filters to customize the report as needed
steps.step3Description: Look for the "Export CSV" or "Print" button in the report toolbar
steps.step4Description: Choose your preferred format (CSV, PDF, or Excel)
steps.step5Description: Choose to save the file to your computer or open it immediately

reports.screenshotCaption: Report toolbar showing Export CSV and Print buttons
reports.note: The "Print" button not only allows you to print a physical copy but also to save the report as a PDF file using your operating system's print-to-PDF feature.

inventory.title: Exporting Inventory Data
inventory.intro: To export your complete inventory data:

steps.step1Description: Navigate to the Inventory section from the main menu
steps.step2Description: Look for the "Export CSV" button in the top-right corner of the inventory page
steps.step3Description: In the export dialog, you can:

options.option1: Choose which products to include (all or filtered selection)
options.option2: Select which fields to include in the export

steps.step4Description: Click "Export" to generate and download the file

inventory.tip: Exporting your full inventory regularly serves as a backup of your product data. Consider scheduling a weekly or monthly export to maintain an offline copy of your inventory information.

sales.title: Exporting Sales Data
sales.intro: To export detailed sales transaction data:

generalSteps.intro: General steps for exporting sales data:
generalSteps.step1Description: Go to Transactions or Reports section as needed
generalSteps.step2Description: Filter by date range, payment method, product, etc. to narrow down the data
generalSteps.step3Description: Use the "Export CSV" button to download the data

customers.title: Exporting Customer Data

steps.step1Description: Navigate to the Customers section from the main menu
steps.step2Description: You can choose to export all customers or select specific ones
steps.step3Description: Click the "Export" button in the toolbar
steps.step4Description: Select the information to include in the export:
steps.step6Description: Click "Export" to generate and download the file

customers.warning: Customer data often contains sensitive personal information. Ensure you comply with applicable data protection regulations (such as GDPR or CCPA) when exporting, storing, and using customer data.

scheduled.title: Scheduled Exports
scheduled.intro: BenchPOS allows you to schedule automatic exports:

recurring.title: Recurring Exports
recurring.description: Schedule exports to run automatically at regular intervals (daily, weekly, or monthly).

email.title: Email Delivery
email.description: Have exports automatically emailed to specified recipients, such as managers or accountants.

cloud.title: Cloud Storage
cloud.description: Configure exports to be saved directly to cloud storage services like Google Drive or Dropbox.

setup.step3Description: Click "Add Scheduled Task" and select "Data Export"
setup.step4Description: Specify what data to export and in what format
setup.step5Description: Define when and how often the export should run
setup.step6Description: Specify where the exported data should be sent or saved
setup.step7Description: Click "Save" to activate the scheduled export

security.title: Data Security Considerations
security.intro: When exporting data from the system, keep these security considerations in mind:

guidelines.title: Important Security Guidelines:
guidelines.item1: Always store exported files securely, especially those containing sensitive information
guidelines.item2: Use password protection when sharing exported files via email
guidelines.item3: Delete exported files when they are no longer needed
guidelines.item4: Be aware of data protection regulations applicable to your business
guidelines.item5: Consider anonymizing data when full customer details are not required
guidelines.item6: Limit scheduled exports to essential personnel only
guidelines.item7: Review who has export permissions in your user security settings

customFields.question: Can I customize the fields included in exported data?
customFields.answer: Yes, most export functions allow you to customize the included fields:

steps.step1: When initiating an export, look for "Export Options" or "Configure Export"
steps.step2: You'll see a list of available fields with checkboxes
steps.step3: Select only the fields you need for your specific purpose
steps.step4: Some exports also allow you to reorder the columns

customFields.additional: You can also save your customized export settings as templates for future use.

fileFormats.question: What's the difference between CSV and Excel exports?

csv.title: CSV (Comma-Separated Values):
csv.item1: Simple text format compatible with almost any software
csv.item2: Limited to a single data sheet
csv.item3: No formatting, formulas, or complex features
csv.item4: Smaller file size, faster to generate

excel.title: Excel (XLSX):
excel.item2: Can include multiple sheets, formatting, and formulas
excel.item3: Supports charts, conditional formatting, and data validation
excel.item4: Larger file size, may take longer to generate for large datasets

answer.conclusion: Choose CSV for simple data export or when using with other software. Choose Excel when you need formatting or plan to work extensively with the data in Excel.

numberFormat.question: Why are my exported numbers appearing as text in Excel?
numberFormat.answer: This commonly happens with CSV files. To fix numeric formatting issues:

solution1.step1: In Excel, select the column containing numeric data
solution1.step3: Choose the appropriate number format (Number, Currency, etc.)

solution2.intro: Alternatively, when opening a new CSV file in Excel:
solution2.step1: Use "Data" > "From Text/CSV" instead of double-clicking the file
solution2.step2: In the import wizard, select the columns containing numbers
solution2.step3: Set the column data format to "Number" before importing

userManagement.title: User Management
userManagement.intro: Learn how to add, edit, and manage user accounts in BenchPOS. Proper user management is essential for maintaining security, controlling access to sensitive information, and ensuring accountability in your business operations.

accessing.title: Accessing User Management
accessing.intro: To access the User Management section:

steps.step1Description: Click on the "User Manager" icon in the main navigation sidebar
steps.step2Description: The User Manager displays a list of all registered users with their details
steps.step3Description: Use the search bar at the top to find specific users by name, email, or role

accessing.screenshotCaption: User Manager showing the list of system users and their details

roles.title: Understanding User Roles
roles.intro: BenchPOS uses a role-based access control system to determine what actions each user can perform:

responsibilities.item2: Access to all reports and financial data

roles.note: User roles determine what parts of the system a user can access and what actions they can perform. Always assign the appropriate role based on the user's job responsibilities and security requirements.

adding.title: Adding New Users
adding.intro: To add a new user to BenchPOS:

steps.step1Description: Click on the "Register new User" option in the sidebar menu

details.item2: Email address (will be used for login)
details.item3: Password (or option to generate a secure password)

steps.step3Description: Choose whether the user should be Active immediately or Inactive until later activation
steps.step4Description: Click the "Save" or "Create User" button to add the new user to the system

adding.tip: Consider setting up new users with an Inactive status first, then activating them only when they're ready to begin using the system. This approach gives you time to properly configure their permissions before they start working.

editing.title: Editing User Accounts
editing.intro: To modify an existing user account:

steps.step1Description: In the User Manager, locate the user you want to edit
steps.step2Description: Click the edit icon (pencil symbol) in the Actions column for that user
steps.step3Description: Update any of the user's information as needed:
steps.step4Description: If the user needs a password reset, use the reset password option
steps.step5Description: Click "Save" or "Update User" to apply the changes

editing.screenshotCaption: User edit screen showing editable fields and options

deactivating.title: Deactivating Users
deactivating.intro: When an employee leaves or no longer needs access to the system:

steps.step1Description: Locate the user in the User Manager
steps.step2Description: Click the edit icon for that user
steps.step3Description: Set the user's status from "Active" to "Inactive"

deactivating.warning: Deactivating a user prevents them from logging into the system but preserves their account and history. This is preferable to deleting the user, which might remove important historical data associated with their account.

permissions.title: Managing User Permissions
permissions.intro: For more granular control over what users can do:

custom.title: Custom Permissions
custom.description: Create custom permission sets that go beyond the standard roles to tailor access precisely to job requirements.

feature.title: Feature Access
feature.description: Control access to specific features, such as the ability to offer discounts, void transactions, or access sensitive reports.

data.title: Data Access
data.description: Restrict access to certain data categories or limit visibility to specific departments or locations.

configuration.step1Description: In User Manager, click "Manage Permissions" in the top menu
configuration.step2Description: Choose to edit permissions for an individual user or an entire role
configuration.step3Description: Use the permissions matrix to enable or disable specific actions
configuration.step4Description: Click "Save Permissions" to apply the changes

permissions.note: Changes to user permissions take effect immediately. Users currently logged into the system may need to log out and log back in to see the changes to their access.

security.title: Security Best Practices
security.intro: To maintain a secure system, follow these user management best practices:

item1.title: Least Privilege Principle:
item1.description: Give users only the minimum access required for their job

item2.title: Regular Audits:
item2.description: Periodically review user accounts and remove or deactivate unused ones

item3.title: Strong Passwords:
item3.description: Enforce strong password policies with minimum complexity requirements

item4.title: Password Rotation:
item4.description: Require password changes at regular intervals (e.g., every 90 days)

item5.title: Unique Accounts:
item5.description: Never share login credentials among multiple employees

item6.title: Access Logs:
item6.description: Regularly review system access logs for unusual activity

item7.title: Off-boarding Process:
item7.description: Establish a clear process for removing system access when employees leave

forgotPassword.question: What should I do if a user forgets their password?

options.option1: Generate a temporary password that the system will email to the user
options.option2: Set a new password manually and communicate it to the user securely

answer.note: For security reasons, BenchPOS does not allow administrators to see users' current passwords.

multipleAdmins.question: Can I have multiple admin users?

answer.intro: Yes, you can have multiple administrators in the system. However, for security and accountability reasons, we recommend:

recommendations.item1: Limiting the number of admin users to only those who absolutely need full system access
recommendations.item2: Creating a custom "Limited Admin" role for users who need some but not all administrative privileges
recommendations.item3: Regularly reviewing the admin user list to ensure it remains current and necessary

answer.note: Each admin should use their own unique login credentials rather than sharing a single admin account.

trackActivity.question: How do I track user activity in the system?

answer.intro: BenchPOS maintains comprehensive activity logs that track user actions:

steps.step3: Use the filters to search by:
steps.step4: View detailed information about each action, including timestamps and affected data
steps.step5: Export logs as needed for record-keeping or auditing purposes

answer.note: These logs cannot be modified by users and provide an audit trail of all system activity.

offlineMode.title: Offline Mode
offlineMode.intro: Learn how to use BenchPOS when you don't have an internet connection. Offline Mode allows you to continue business operations during internet outages, in locations with poor connectivity, or while on the go, with all changes synchronized when you reconnect.

understanding.title: Understanding Offline Mode

storage.title: Local Storage
storage.description: Storing a copy of essential data in a local database on your device for access without an internet connection.

processing.title: Background Processing
processing.description: Processing transactions locally while you're offline and preparing them for synchronization when you reconnect.

sync.title: Automatic Sync
sync.description: Automatically detecting when you're back online and synchronizing all offline changes with the main database.

understanding.note: Note: Offline Mode is designed to provide uninterrupted access to essential business functions during temporary internet outages or in locations with poor connectivity. It's not intended as a permanent substitute for online operation.

enabling.title: Enabling Offline Mode
enabling.description: Offline Mode can be enabled manually or will activate automatically when connectivity is lost:

manual.title: Manual Activation
manual.description: To manually switch to Offline Mode:
steps: Click on the connectivity indicator in the top-right corner of the screen
Select "Switch to Offline Mode" from the dropdown menu

automatic.title: Automatic Activation
automatic.description: When the system detects a loss of internet connection:
steps: A notification will appear informing you of the connection loss
The system will automatically switch to Offline Mode
The connectivity indicator will change to show you're working offline

initialSetup.title: Initial Setup
initialSetup.description: The first time you use Offline Mode, the system will:
steps: Download necessary data to your local device
Set up the local database structure
Confirm when the setup is complete and Offline Mode is ready

screenshot.caption: The connectivity indicator showing that the system is in Offline Mode

working.title: Working in Offline Mode
working.description: While in Offline Mode, you can continue to perform most essential business functions:

sales.notes: Full functionality for creating invoices and processing sales

inventory.notes: Can view inventory and make basic adjustments; some advanced features unavailable

customer.notes: Can access existing customer records and create new ones

returns.notes: Can process returns for transactions that exist in the local database

reports.notes: Basic reports available; comprehensive reports limited to local data

settings.notes: Most system settings can only be changed online

working.tip: Pro Tip: While working offline, you'll see an "Offline" indicator in the upper right corner of your screen. This serves as a reminder that any changes you make will need to be synchronized when you reconnect to the internet.

syncing.title: Synchronizing When Reconnected
syncing.description: When you regain internet connectivity, you'll need to synchronize your offline changes:

steps.title: Automatic Detection
steps.description: The system will automatically detect when internet connectivity is restored

steps.title: Sync Notification
steps.description: You'll see a notification indicating that data needs to be synchronized

steps.title: Initiate Sync
steps.description: Click on the "Sync Now" button in the notification or in the Data Synchronization panel

steps.title: Sync Process
steps.description: The system will:
subSteps: Upload local changes to the main database
Download any updates made by other users while you were offline
Reconcile any conflicts between offline and online data

steps.title: Completion
steps.description: Once synchronization is complete, you'll receive a confirmation message

screenshot.caption: Data Synchronization panel showing items to be synced

limitations.title: Limitations of Offline Mode
limitations.description: While Offline Mode is designed to be robust, there are some inherent limitations to be aware of:

dataAvailability.title: Data Availability:
dataAvailability.description: Only data that was previously downloaded to your device is accessible offline

storage.title: Storage Constraints:
storage.description: Large databases may be partially available due to device storage limitations

features.title: Feature Restrictions:
features.description: Some advanced features require an online connection

updates.title: Real-time Updates:
updates.description: You won't receive updates made by other users until you synchronize

conflicts.title: Conflict Potential:
conflicts.description: Changes to the same data by different offline users may cause conflicts

extendedPeriods.title: Extended Offline Periods:
extendedPeriods.description: Long periods offline increase the complexity of synchronization

bestPractices.title: Best Practices for Offline Usage
bestPractices.description: To make the most of Offline Mode while minimizing potential issues:

practices.title: Regular Synchronization
practices.description: Sync your data whenever you have internet connectivity to minimize the amount of offline changes

practices.title: Pre-Download Data
practices.description: If you know you'll be working offline, manually initiate a full data sync before going offline

practices.title: Limit User Count
practices.description: When possible, limit the number of users working offline simultaneously to reduce conflict potential

practices.title: Manage Storage
practices.description: Ensure your device has adequate storage space for the local database

practices.title: Regular Backups
practices.description: If working offline extensively, consider exporting critical data periodically as a backup

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting Offline Issues
troubleshooting.description: If you encounter problems with Offline Mode, try these solutions:

switching.question: System won't switch to Offline Mode automatically

solutions.title: Possible solutions:
items: Check if Offline Mode is enabled in System Settings > Offline Mode > Enable Automatic Offline Mode
Verify that the initial offline data download has been completed
Try manually switching to Offline Mode
Restart the application and try again

solutions.title: Troubleshooting steps:
items: Check your internet connection stability
Manually open the Data Synchronization panel and click "Refresh Status"
Try clicking "Sync Now" to force the synchronization process
If problems persist, go to Settings > Maintenance > Repair Database Connections
As a last resort, export any critical offline data and restart the application

solutions.description: When the system detects conflicts between offline and online data:
steps: A conflict resolution dialog will appear

steps.text: For each item, choose whether to:

steps: For complex conflicts, consider exporting both versions for manual reconciliation
solutions.note: To minimize conflicts, synchronize frequently and coordinate with other users when working offline.

syncingData.title: Syncing Data
syncingData.intro: Learn how to synchronize data between devices and ensure all your business information stays up-to-date across multiple locations or devices using BenchPOS. Data synchronization is essential for businesses operating with multiple terminals or in different locations.

overview.title: Data Synchronization Overview
overview.description: Data synchronization in BenchPOS ensures that all your devices and locations have access to the same, up-to-date information. This is particularly important when:

locations.title: Multiple Locations
locations.description: Running your business across different physical locations while maintaining a single, consolidated database.

devices.title: Multiple Devices
devices.description: Using multiple terminals, computers, or mobile devices to access your business data.

transitions.title: Offline/Online Transitions
transitions.description: Switching between offline and online operations, ensuring all offline changes are properly integrated.

overview.note: Data synchronization includes all aspects of your business data, including inventory, sales transactions, customer information, pricing updates, and system settings. The synchronization process is designed to be efficient, transferring only the data that has changed since the last sync.

process.title: The Synchronization Process
process.description: Data synchronization in BenchPOS follows these general steps:

steps.title: Change Detection
steps.description: The system identifies new or modified data on both the local device and the central database

steps.title: Data Transmission
steps.description: Changes are securely transmitted between the device and the server

steps.title: Conflict Identification
steps.description: The system checks for any conflicting changes (same data modified differently in multiple places)

steps.title: Conflict Resolution
steps.description: Conflicts are resolved either automatically using predefined rules or manually by user intervention

steps.title: Data Integration
steps.description: All changes are integrated into both the local and central databases

steps.title: Verification
steps.description: The system verifies that synchronization was successful

manual.title: Manual Synchronization
manual.description: To manually initiate a data synchronization:

steps.title: Access Sync Panel
steps.description: Click on the Data Synchronization icon in the bottom right corner of the application

steps.title: Review Sync Status
steps.description: The panel will show the current sync status, including:
items: Number of items pending synchronization
Categories of data that need to be synced (Products, Invoices, etc.)
Direction of sync (upload, download, or both)
Any potential conflicts

steps.title: Initiate Sync
steps.description: Click the "Sync Now" button to start the synchronization process

steps.title: Monitor Progress
steps.description: A progress indicator will display the status of the synchronization

steps.title: Review Results
steps.description: Once complete, the system will provide a summary of the synchronized items

screenshot.caption: Data Synchronization panel showing details of items to be synced and the Sync Now button

manual.tip: Before starting a large manual sync, consider saving any open work and closing other applications to ensure your device has adequate resources for the synchronization process.

auto.title: Automatic Synchronization
auto.description: BenchPOS can also perform automatic synchronization:

timed.description: System automatically syncs at regular intervals (e.g., every 15 minutes)

connection.description: Automatic sync when internet connection is restored after being offline

startup.description: Sync occurs when the application is launched

events.description: Sync after critical operations (e.g., large inventory adjustments)
events.configurable: Partially - Some events are always synced

scheduled.description: Sync at specific times of day (e.g., opening, closing)

steps.title: Go to Settings
steps.description: Navigate to Settings > System Settings > Data Synchronization

steps.title: Configure Auto-Sync Options
steps.description: Set your preferred automatic synchronization options:
items: Enable/disable different types of automatic syncs
Set the frequency for timed synchronization
Configure specific scheduled sync times
Set conditions for critical event synchronization

steps.title: Save Settings
steps.description: Click "Save" to apply your auto-sync configuration

conflicts.title: Handling Synchronization Conflicts
conflicts.description: Sometimes, the same data may be modified in different ways on multiple devices before synchronization. When this happens, a conflict occurs that needs resolution:

steps.title: Conflict Detection
steps.description: During synchronization, the system will identify any conflicting changes

steps.title: Notification
steps.description: If conflicts are detected, you'll see a notification and the number of conflicts in the sync panel

steps.title: Conflict Resolution Dialog
steps.description: Click on "Resolve Conflicts" to open the resolution dialog

steps.title: Review Each Conflict
steps.description: For each conflict, you'll see:
items: The type of data involved (product, invoice, etc.)
The specific item with a conflict
The differences between the local and server versions

steps.title: Choose Resolution
steps.description: For each conflict, select one of these options:
items: "Use Local Version" - Keep the changes from your device
"Use Server Version" - Discard local changes in favor of the server version
"Merge Changes" - Combine changes where possible (available for some data types)
"Review Details" - See a detailed comparison to make an informed decision

steps.title: Apply Resolutions
steps.description: After resolving all conflicts, click "Apply Resolutions" to complete the sync

conflicts.warning: Resolving conflicts requires careful consideration to avoid data loss. If you're unsure about which version to keep, click "Review Details" to see the specific differences before making a decision.

monitoring.title: Monitoring Sync Status
monitoring.description: You can monitor the synchronization status of your system at any time:

indicator.title: Sync Indicator
indicator.description: The sync icon in the application shows the current sync status with color coding (green: in sync, yellow: pending changes, red: sync issues).

history.title: Sync History
history.description: View detailed synchronization history, including times, volumes, and any issues that occurred.

notifications.title: Sync Notifications
notifications.description: Receive notifications about important sync events, such as completed syncs or conflicts requiring attention.

steps.title: Open Sync Panel
steps.description: Click on the Data Synchronization icon in the bottom right corner

steps.title: View Sync History
steps.description: Click on "Sync History" to see a record of past synchronizations

steps.title: Review Details
steps.description: Click on any history entry to view detailed information about that synchronization

settings.title: Configuring Sync Settings
settings.description: Advanced users can customize various aspects of the synchronization system:

frequency.recommended: All users - Adjust based on business volume

rules.description: Default rules for handling different types of conflicts
rules.recommended: Advanced users - Critical for multi-location setups

bandwidth.description: Controls for limiting sync bandwidth during busy periods

categories.description: Which types of data should synchronize automatically
categories.recommended: All users - Based on business priorities

network.description: Network conditions required for sync (e.g., Wi-Fi only)
network.recommended: Mobile users or those with metered connections

configuration.title: To access and configure these settings:

steps.title: Go to Settings
steps.description: Navigate to Settings > System Settings > Data Synchronization

steps.title: Select Advanced Settings
steps.description: Click on "Advanced Sync Settings" to access the detailed configuration options

steps.title: Configure Options
steps.description: Adjust the various settings according to your business needs

steps.title: Save Changes
steps.description: Click "Save" to apply your configuration

settings.tip: If you operate multiple locations with different internet connectivity qualities, consider setting up location-specific sync schedules. For example, locations with slower internet might sync less frequently but during off-peak hours.

bandwidth.question: Does synchronization use a lot of internet bandwidth?

answer.intro: BenchPOS is designed to be bandwidth-efficient:
points: Only changed data is transferred during synchronization, not the entire database
Data is compressed before transmission to reduce bandwidth usage
Large image files and attachments can be set to synchronize only during specified time periods
You can configure bandwidth limits in the advanced sync settings
answer.conclusion: Typical daily sync operations for a small to medium business usually consume less than 10-50 MB of data per day, depending on transaction volume.

security.question: Is my data secure during synchronization?

answer.intro: Yes, BenchPOS employs several security measures during data synchronization:
points: All data is encrypted using industry-standard TLS/SSL protocols during transmission
User authentication is required before any synchronization can occur
Synchronized data is verified using checksums to ensure integrity
The system maintains detailed logs of all synchronization activities for audit purposes
Sensitive data elements can be configured to synchronize only over secure networks

verification.question: How do I know if my system is properly synchronized?

answer.intro: There are several ways to verify synchronization status:
points: Check the sync indicator icon - Green indicates everything is synchronized
Open the Data Synchronization panel to see if there are any pending items
Review the sync history to see the last successful synchronization time
Perform a manual "Refresh Status" in the sync panel to check for any undetected changes
For a comprehensive check, go to Settings > System Maintenance > Database Status to run a full verification
answer.conclusion: If you're working across multiple locations, you can also compare transaction IDs or inventory counts as a quick sanity check.

contactSupport.title: Contact Support
contactSupport.intro: Need help with BenchPOS? Our support team is ready to assist you.

email.title: Email Support
email.description: Send us a detailed description of your issue.

responseTime.question: How long does it typically take to get a response?
responseTime.answer: We aim to respond to all support tickets within 24 business hours. For urgent issues, we recommend using the live chat or phone support options for faster assistance.

remoteAssistance.question: Do you offer remote assistance?
remoteAssistance.answer: Yes, our support team can provide remote assistance for complex technical issues. This service is available for customers with active support plans.

reportingInfo.question: What information should I include when reporting an issue?

answer.intro: To help us resolve your issue quickly, please include:
items: Your operating system and version
The version of BenchPOS you're using
Step-by-step details of what you were doing when the issue occurred
Any error messages you received
Screenshots if applicable
